subject: Law
title: Illegality as a Defense
description: A quick, practical guide to Illegality as a Defense.

hook.text: You hire someone to commit a crime and they don't follow through. Can you sue for breach? Absolutely not.

buildup.text: Contracts with illegal purposes are void from the start. Courts won't enforce them for either party.

discovery.text: This includes contracts for illegal services, agreements that violate public policy, and unlicensed work.

twist.text: If only part of a contract is illegal, courts may sever the bad part and enforce the rest.

climax.text: Neither party can recover under an illegal contract. The law leaves them where it found them.

punchline.text: An illegal deal is no deal at all.

quiz.question: What happens to a contract with an illegal purpose?
options: Only the illegal party is penalized
It's void and unenforceable for both parties
